title: Timeless Adventure
subtitle: Each month we invite one of our reviewers to recommend a wildlife book - novel, guide or textbook - that most influenced them or their work. Here, Diana Foster, producer and presenter for Wildlife Today, reveals all.

cards.text: I'm a passionate reader, but choosing the book that most influenced me was surprisingly difficult. With the arrival of autumn and winter, the appeal of Iceland's cities and villages intensifies. I'm a keen admirer of historical characters; with historical tales, my fascination with Iceland began in my late teens. Set in 1918, in a remote town of Reykjavik, it tells the story of a young boy whose parents have passed away. He is sent to live in the breathtaking landscape of Akureyri with his uncle and cousins. They live in a series of small cottages scattered across the countryside.

cards.text: The book seamlessly blends adventure, intrigue, honor, friendship, danger, hardship - all experienced through the perspective of the young protagonist, Erik. I still consider this a captivating read. Erik's deep appreciation for nature was inspiring and moving. But above all, it was the sense of location that resonated with me. The book provides the reader with a vivid impression of the expansive northern landscapes and their magnificent skies, without extensive descriptive passages that might bore younger readers. There are no restrictions. The wilderness of the Arctic region, the dramatic mountains, and the thrill of traversing forests and navigating challenging terrain captivated me.
